result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxine Haskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $750.00 including all mandatory court costs, victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 8/21/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any  other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxine Haskins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Granting Return of Property as stated in the order, signed and filed. sab
Return of property hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 3 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-$750.00 fine including all mandatory court costs, victim/witness surcharges and DNA surcharge to be paid by 8/21/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample 
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Because of the possibility of incarceration, the defendant should be prepared to begin serving the sentence at the next date.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.  

Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received a new offer and would like to review the same with the defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has not received the CD as yet and is asking for another pretrial date.  Defendant is starting a new full-time job on 3-31-14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Attorney Essling is asking to bring case in early.  Defendant is starting a new job./ds

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs to obtain a CD and review with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Maxine Haskins in court with attorney Adam Essling.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Maxine Haskins not in court.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
